moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: This move let white invade. He should instead put up a wall with h5.
moves.14. h5 Rfe8 15. hxg6 hxg6: Thanks to white's handy b3 bishop, he can't capture back the preferred way, fxg6
moves.16. Bh6 Bh8: The move that stops immediate mate.
moves.17. Bf8: Bh6! Looks really pointless, right? well, no. The bishop was just in the way. Getting rid of it helps.

opening: Sicilian (B76), dragon, Yugoslav attack, Rauser variation
